description.narrative:
CMAG acts as the custodian of the Commonwealth’s fundamental political values. It is a high-level ministerial mechanism through which serious or persistent violations of these political values are addressed. It strives to encourage countries that fail to adhere to Commonwealth fundamental values to address these failures in a timely manner.
The work of the Group complements the political initiatives of the Secretary-General, including her Good Offices.
CMAG has the ability to suspend a country from Commonwealth membership in the event of serious or persistent violations of Commonwealth fundamental political values. The option of suspension has been most commonly exercised in instances of an unconstitutional overthrow of a democratic government. However, that and other sanctions are available for other serious or persistent violations. CMAG is also able to indicate its concern over a country situation by placing that country on its formal agenda. This allows for a close degree of ministerial scrutiny of developments of concern in that country.
The aim of CMAG's work is to encourage member countries to adhere more closely to Commonwealth fundamental political values.
CMAG is convened by the Commonwealth Secretary-General. CMAG meetings are facilitated by the Secretariat and the Group is provided with comprehensive briefings.
